stream_context.summary: Kaze fixes Course 7 and builds a new mushroom-forest section of the overworld while struggling with fresh Windows 11 and Blender 4.2 setups; begins preparations to import Pixelpalabra’s Luigi model.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 is “fully functional again”; only the five Yoshi coins still need to be placed.
development_findings.quote: Career 7 is now fully functional again. I just need to add the five Yoshi coins.

development_findings.summary: Kaze upgraded to Windows 11, switched to DaVinci Resolve and Blender 4.2, and is dealing with crashes, new hotkeys, and dramatically slower load times.
development_findings.quote: I updated to Windows 11 recently… I also have had two blue screens since I updated.

development_findings.summary: He is using a custom, in-development build of Project64 with working audio and other improvements, testing all content on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: I also have a completely custom version of Project 64 now… the audio actually works.

development_findings.summary: Pixelpalabra’s Luigi model matches Biobak’s Mario style; Kaze plans to purge unused files this week to free RAM so Luigi can be added, likely as a straight playable character.
development_findings.quote: Maybe tomorrow I can start cleaning out some unused files… and it will open up enough memory for Luigi to fit into RAM.

development_findings.summary: Mushroom-floor visuals: initial search for seamless textures failed; AI generators rejected for quality; final solution was Zeina’s hand-made mushroom clusters plus a 1 % opacity background color and CI-4 indexing via GIMP.
development_findings.quote: I don't think AI texture generation is anywhere near the level where it can actually be used.

development_findings.summary: Wide-screen mode costs only ~3 FPS (36→33) on real hardware, confirming negligible performance impact.
development_findings.quote: We got 36 FPS… turn on widescreen… 33.5.

development_findings.summary: Future tasks flagged: Bowser’s oil tanker area, overworld background skybox, and the Divine Dino Domain section teased by Biobak.
Kaze is considering a commissioned 120-star “Groot” major hack that would be built in about one month for a promised US$5,000.
development_findings.quote: So there is a good chance that we will speedrun making a Groots major hack at some point… if the guy pays $5000 for it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses low motivation, fatigue, and frustration with new software but excitement about Luigi and the project’s progress.
context_findings.quote: Guys, I have to admit something. So far, I don't feel very motivated…

context_findings.summary: He critiques corporate performative activism and discusses personal philosophy about time value, automation (automatic lawn-mowers), and caffeine/pre-workout use.
context_findings.quote: 600 bucks for an automatic lawnmower is only a bad deal if your time is almost worthless.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: upgraded PC environment, suffered blue screens, and notes that stimulants may hurt his mental clarity.
context_findings.quote: It is crazy how I feel like I can speak and think so much clearer when I don't take pre-workout in the morning.

biobak.summary: Provides feedback on lighting tricks and offers to add real 3D lights if informed in advance.
biobak.quote: If it's for like a special effect, I can add an actual light coming from underneath instead of doing the ambient thing.

biobak.summary: Teases the upcoming Divine Dino Domain course and continues refining graphics/models.

zeina.summary: Creates mushroom-cluster decal textures; collaborates with Kaze to adjust palette and transparency.

key_stories.title: Windows 11 Toolchain Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s forced OS upgrade breaks his workflow: Blender loads crawl, hotkeys change, and crashes occur. He replaces Sony Vegas with DaVinci Resolve and fights through new UI pain while streaming.
key_stories.challenge: Old Windows 10 install was corrupted and out of support.
key_stories.process: Clean-install Windows 11, adopt new versions of DaVinci Resolve and Blender 4.2, troubleshoot missing features and bugs live.
key_stories.outcome: Environment mostly working but still unstable; Kaze vows to adapt despite slower modeling speed.
key_stories.key_quote: The new hotkeys are really rough to get used to for me. I will be pretty slow today.

key_stories.title: Bringing Luigi to RTYI
key_stories.summary: Pixelpalabra delivered a Luigi model matching Biobak’s Mario. Memory on real hardware is tight, so Kaze plans a file-cleanup sprint to fit Luigi and make him a straightforward playable character.
key_stories.challenge: N64 RAM budget nearly maxed out.
key_stories.process: Audit RTYI asset folders, delete unused files, and test memory usage.
key_stories.outcome: Work scheduled for this week; Luigi import expected soon.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm probably importing the Luigi this week… it will open up enough memory for Luigi to fit into RAM.

key_stories.title: The Mushroom Floor Texture Saga
key_stories.summary: The new overworld forest needed believable mushroom ground cover. AI texture tools failed, Krita bugged out, and Photoshop’s alpha bug re-emerged. Kaze and Zeina switched to GIMP, manually set a 16-color palette, and added 1 % opaque background pixels to avoid white outlines on N64 filtering.
key_stories.challenge: Create a seamless, low-color mushroom texture that survives N64 filtering.
key_stories.process: Test AI generators, reject results; explore Krita but discover palette bug; finally use GIMP, hand-edit transparency, down-sample to CI-4.
key_stories.outcome: High-quality mushroom clusters now appear in game without artifacts.
key_stories.key_quote: Transparent pixels have a color too, and the N64’s bilinear filtering will blend your textures into the background’s color.

key_stories.title: Potential ‘Groot’ Speed-Hack Commission
key_stories.summary: An unnamed client offered ~$5 k for a Groot-themed 120-star hack. Kaze contemplates reusing RTYI tech and speed-building levels in under a month, seeing comedic potential.
key_stories.challenge: Deliver a full major hack rapidly while keeping RTYI on track.
key_stories.process: Plan to pre-select about 15 environments, prep ~100 textures, and model at sprint pace.
key_stories.outcome: Project is pending; if payment arrives, team will attempt a one-month production blitz.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re probably going to try to make the whole thing within like a month… I think it has huge comedy potential.

open_questions.context: Kaze will ‘clean out unused files’ so Luigi can ‘fit into RAM,’ but no numbers or techniques were given.
questions: How much memory does Luigi’s model and animations require?
Which assets are being removed or optimized to free space?
Will Luigi share code and moveset with Mario or introduce new mechanics?

open_questions.context: Kaze said it will be a ‘straight Luigi’ similar to Galaxy but did not clarify gameplay impact.
questions: Will Luigi be an optional character, post-game reward, or selectable from the start?
Any planned differences in physics, voice, or moves?
How will levels accommodate two character sizes?

open_questions.context: Biobak keeps ‘teasing’ the area; no concrete timeline or design details were given.
questions: What is the design vision for Divine Dino Domain?
Which mechanics or set-pieces make it distinct?

open_questions.context: Kaze showed an in-dev emulator with audio fixes but did not say if it will be public.
questions: What specific improvements have been made beyond audio?
Will the modified Project64 be released with RTYI?
How does it assist real-hardware parity testing?
What is the conceptual art or inspiration for the oil tanker?
Any technical challenges anticipated for moving ship parts or water?
Who is responsible for the skybox artwork and what style is planned?
